Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Causality \Cau*sal"i*ty\, n.; pl. {Causalities}. 1. The agency of a cause; the action or power of a cause, in producing its effect. [1913 Webster]
The causality of the divine mind. --Whewell. [1913 Webster]
2. (Phren.) The faculty of tracing effects to their causes. --G. Combe. [1913 Webster]
causality n : the relation between causes and effects
